title.narrative: Sindh Cities Improvement Investment Program - Tranche 2

description.narrative: The project focuses on priority infrastructure identified by North Sindh Urban Services Corporation Ltd (NSUSC) based on existing master plans and ongoing master planning exercise in Ghotki, Jacobabad, Khairpur, New Sukkur, Rohri, and Shikarpur.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: Increased quality, reliability, and coverage of water supply, wastewater, and solid waste management services in participating towns

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President
Water distribution network access increased from 37% in 2012 to 80% of the population by 2016 in Sukkur, New Sukkur, Rohri and Khairpur

description.narrative: Increased quality, reliability, and coverage of water supply, wastewater, and solid waste management services in participating towns

title.narrative: Average hours per day of water supply increased from 4 hours in 2012 to over 10 hours for 65% of population by 2016 in Sukkur, New Sukkur, Rohri and Khairpur

description.narrative: Increased quality, reliability, and coverage of water supply, wastewater, and solid waste management services in participating towns

title.narrative: Population with household water connections increased to 65% by 2016 from 40% in 2012 at Sukkur, New Sukkur, Rohri and Khairpur

description.narrative: Increased quality, reliability, and coverage of water supply, wastewater, and solid waste management services in participating towns

title.narrative: Household access to secondary SWM services increased on average from 65% in 2012 to 85% by 2016 at Sukkur, New Sukkur, Rohri and Khairpur

description.narrative: Increased quality, reliability, and coverage of water supply, wastewater, and solid waste management services in participating towns
